titleStmt.title: Newes from Leicester being the copie of a letter sent from thence the 6 of Iune, to Mr. VVilliam Iones inhabitant in Covent Garden, wherein is declared how the Earle of Stamford being sent thither by the Parliament to see the militia ordered ... met with another nobleman sent thither by His Majesty for the same purpose ... another letter sent to Mr. Speaker from the commissioners in the county of Essex concerning the militia.

Newes from Leicester being the copie of a letter sent from thence the 6 of Iune, to Mr. VVilliam Iones inhabitant in Covent Garden, wherein is declared how the Earle of Stamford being sent thither by the Parliament to see the militia ordered ... met with another nobleman sent thither by His Majesty for the same purpose ... another letter sent to Mr. Speaker from the commissioners in the county of Essex concerning the militia.
titleStmt.author: Jones, Adam, 17th cent.
Barrington, Thomas, Sir.

notesStmt.note: First letter signed: Thomas Barrington [and 8 others]; second letter signed: Adam Iones.
"June 8, 1642. Ordered to be forthwith published and printed. Henry Elsing, Cler. Parl. D. Comm."
This item appears at reel 1489:41 as Wing N979A (number cancelled in 2nd ed.), and at reel 1741:26 as Wing J903A.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.
